node.statement: Prove the reverse direction of the O-Slice Connectivity Theorem. Assume X is connective and Phi^H(X) is floor(n/|H|)-connected for all H in F_O. We must show [Sigma, X]^G = 0 for all O-slice cells Sigma of dim < n. Proceed by induction on |H| (ascending). Base case H = e: pi_k(X) = pi_k(Phi^e(X)) = 0 for k < n. Inductive step: use the isotropy separation long exact sequence and tom Dieck splitting. The splitting introduces subgroups K < H; since F_O is a family (closed under subgroups), K is in F_O, so the inductive hypothesis applies. This is the hardest step and the reason for defining F_O as a family rather than just Sub_O^tr(G).
